item.title: Tim add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "God has no religion." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Tim add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "There are three rules for writing a novel. Unfortunately, no one knows what they are." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Tim add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "My main reason for adopting literature as a profession was that, as the author is never seen by his clients, he need not dress respectably." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Tim add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Reason is intelligence taking exercise. Imagination is intelligence with an erection." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Tim add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Tim add a quote by Erle Stanley Gardner
item.description: "It's a damn good story. If you have any comments, write them on the back of a check." -- Erle Stanley Gardner

item.title: Tim add a quote by John Grisham
item.description: "Critics should find meaningful work." -- John Grisham

item.title: Tim add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr
item.description: "Men do not quit playing because they grow old; they grow old because they quit playing." -- Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr

item.title: Tim add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Ideas are, in truth, forces. Infinite, too, is the power of personality. A union of the two always makes history." -- Henry James

item.title: Tim add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Tim add a quote by Tim Campbell
item.description: "Imagination is like muscle. If you don't exercise it, it shrinks." -- Tim Campbell

item.title: Tim add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Tim add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Tim add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Tim add a quote by Kinky Friedman
item.description: "The art of writing fiction is to sail as dangerously close to the truth as possible without sinking the ship" -- Kinky Friedman

item.title: Tim add a quote by Kinky Friedman
item.description: "If you're lookin' for a helpin' hand, try the one at the end of your arm." -- Kinky Friedman

item.title: Tim add a quote by Kinky Friedman
item.description: "Always respect your superiors, if you have any." -- Kinky Friedman

item.title: Tim add a quote by Kinky Friedman
item.description: "Never re-elect anybody" -- Kinky Friedman

item.title: Tim add a quote by Kinky Friedman
item.description: "A fool and his money are soon elected" -- Kinky Friedman

item.title: Tim add a quote by Kinky Friedman
item.description: "I'm going to lower the drinking age to eighteen. If you're old enough to die in Iraq, you're old enough to drink." -- Kinky Friedman

item.title: Tim add a quote by Kinky Friedman
item.description: "Man's ability to delude himself is infinite." -- Kinky Friedman

item.title: Tim add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "If voting changed anything, they'd make it illegal." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Tim add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "It is essential that we realize once and for all that man is much more of a sex creature than a moral creature. The former is inherent, the other is grafted on. " -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Tim add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "Consciously or unconsciously, most theists see in gods and devils, heaven and hell, reward and punishment, a whip to lash the people into obedience, meekness and contentment.…" -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Tim add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "Someone has said that it requires less mental effort to condemn than to think." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Tim add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "The most violent element in society is ignorance. " -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Tim add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "The political arena leaves one no alternative, one must either be a dunce or a rogue. " -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Tim add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "When we can't dream any longer we die." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Tim add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "To the moralist prostitution does not consist so much in the fact that the woman sells her body, but rather that she sells it out of wedlock." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Tim add a quote by Cornwall
item.description: "Write, if it be but a line a day" -- Cornwall
